CF_Preview_StopAll lua.description: Stop and destroy all currently active preview objects.

CF_SelectTrackFX lua.description: Set which track effect is active in the track's FX chain. The FX chain window does not have to be open.

CF_SetClipboard lua.description: Write the given string into the system clipboard.

CF_SetCustomColor lua.description: Set one of 16 SWS custom colors (0xBBGGRR on Windows, 0xRRGGBB everyhwere else). Index is zero-based.

CF_SetMediaSourceOnline lua.description: Set the online/offline status of the given source (closes files when set=false).

CF_ShellExecute lua.description: Open the given file or URL in the default application. See also CF_LocateInExplorer.

FNG_AddMidiNote lua.description: [FNG] Add MIDI note to MIDI take

FNG_AllocMidiTake lua.description: [FNG] Allocate a RprMidiTake from a take pointer. Returns a NULL pointer if the take is not an in-project MIDI take

FNG_CountMidiNotes lua.description: [FNG] Count of how many MIDI notes are in the MIDI take

FNG_FreeMidiTake lua.description: [FNG] Commit changes to MIDI take and free allocated memory

FNG_GetMidiNote lua.description: [FNG] Get a MIDI note from a MIDI take at specified index

Fab_Clear lua.description: Clears ReaFab control map, optionally based on matching idString. Returns true on success.

Fab_Do lua.description: Runs ReaFab actions/commands. First parameter (command) is ReaFab command number, e.g. 3 for 3rd encoder rotation. Second parameter (val) is MIDI CC Relative value. Value 1 is increment of 1, 127 is decrement of 1. 2 is inc 2, 126 is dec 2 and so on. For button press (commands 9-32) a value of 127 is recommended.

Fab_Dump lua.description: Dumps current control mapping into .lua file under ResourcePath/Scripts/reafab_dump-timestamp.lua

Fab_Get lua.description: Returns target FX and parameter index for given ReaFab command in context of selected track and ReaFab FX index. Valid command range 1 ... 24. Returns false if no such command mapping is found. Returns param index -1 for ReaFab internal band change command.

Fab_Map lua.description:
Creates control mapping for ReaFab command.
fxId e.g. 'ReaComp'.
command 1-8 for encoders, 9-24 for buttons.
paramId e.g. 'Ratio'.
control 1 = direct, 2 = band selector, 3 = cycle, 4 = invert, 5 = force toggle, 6 = force range, 7 = 5 and 6, 8 = force continuous.
bands define, if target fx has multiple identical target bands. In this case, paramId must include 00 placeholder, e.g. 'Band 00 Gain'.
step overrides built-in default step of ~0.001 for continuous parameters.
accel overrides built-in default control acceleration step of 1.0.
minval & maxval override default detected target param value range.
Prefixing paramId with '-' reverses direction; useful for creating separate next/previous mappings for bands or list type value navigation.

ImGui_AcceptDragDropPayload lua.description:
Accept contents of a given type. If DragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery is set
you can peek into the payload before the mouse button is released.

ImGui_AcceptDragDropPayloadFiles lua.description: Accept a list of dropped files. See AcceptDragDropPayload and GetDragDropPayloadFile.

ImGui_AcceptDragDropPayloadRGB lua.description: Accept a RGB color. See AcceptDragDropPayload.

ImGui_AcceptDragDropPayloadRGBA lua.description: Accept a RGBA color. See AcceptDragDropPayload.

ImGui_AlignTextToFramePadding lua.description:
Vertically align upcoming text baseline to StyleVar_FramePadding.y so that it
will align properly to regularly framed items (call if you have text on a line
before a framed item).

ImGui_ArrowButton lua.description: Square button with an arrow shape. 'dir' is one of the Dir_* values

ImGui_Attach lua.description:
Link the object's lifetime to the given context.
Objects can be draw list splitters, fonts, images, list clippers, etc.
Call Detach to let the object be garbage-collected after unuse again.
List clipper objects may only be attached to the context they were created for.
Fonts are (currently) a special case: they must be attached to the context
before usage. Furthermore, fonts may only be attached or detached immediately
after the context is created or before any other function calls modifying the
context per defer cycle. See 'limitations' in the font API documentation.

ImGui_Begin lua.description:
Push window to the stack and start appending to it.
- Passing true to 'p_open' shows a window-closing widget in the upper-right
corner of the window, which clicking will set the boolean to false when returned.
- You may append multiple times to the same window during the same frame by
calling Begin()/End() pairs multiple times. Some information such as 'flags'
or 'p_open' will only be considered by the first call to Begin().
- Begin() return false to indicate the window is collapsed or fully clipped,
so you may early out and omit submitting anything to the window.

ImGui_BeginChild lua.description:
For each independent axis of 'size':
- > 0.0: fixed size
- = 0.0: use remaining host window size
- < 0.0: use remaining window size minus abs(size)
(Each axis can use a different mode, e.g. size = 0x400.)
Returns false to indicate the window is collapsed or fully clipped, so you may early out and omit submitting anything to the window.

ImGui_BeginCombo lua.description:
The BeginCombo/EndCombo API allows you to manage your contents and selection
state however you want it, by creating e.g. Selectable items.

ImGui_BeginDisabled lua.description:
Disable all user interactions and dim items visuals
(applying StyleVar_DisabledAlpha over current colors).
BeginDisabled(false) essentially does nothing useful but is provided to
facilitate use of boolean expressions.
If you can avoid calling BeginDisabled(false)/EndDisabled() best to avoid it.

ImGui_BeginDragDropSource lua.description:
Call after submitting an item which may be dragged. when this return true,
you can call SetDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropSource()
If you stop calling BeginDragDropSource() the payload is preserved however
it won't have a preview tooltip (we currently display a fallback '...' tooltip
as replacement).

ImGui_BeginDragDropTarget lua.description:
Call after submitting an item that may receive a payload.
If this returns true, you can call AcceptDragDropPayload + EndDragDropTarget.

ImGui_BeginGroup lua.description: Lock horizontal starting position. See EndGroup.

ImGui_BeginListBox lua.description:
Open a framed scrolling region. This is essentially a thin wrapper to using
BeginChild/EndChild with some stylistic changes.
The BeginListBox/EndListBox API allows you to manage your contents and selection
state however you want it, by creating e.g. Selectable or any items.
- Choose frame width:
- width  > 0.0: custom
- width  < 0.0 or -FLT_MIN: right-align
- width  = 0.0 (default): use current ItemWidth
- Choose frame height:
- height > 0.0: custom
- height < 0.0 or -FLT_MIN: bottom-align
- height = 0.0 (default): arbitrary default height which can fit ~7 items
See EndListBox.

ImGui_BeginMenu lua.description: Create a sub-menu entry. only call EndMenu if this returns true!

ImGui_BeginMenuBar lua.description:
Append to menu-bar of current window (requires WindowFlags_MenuBar flag set
on parent window). See EndMenuBar.

ImGui_BeginPopup lua.description:
Query popup state, if open start appending into the window. Call EndPopup
afterwards. WindowFlags* are forwarded to the window.
Return true if the popup is open, and you can start outputting to it.

ImGui_BeginPopupContextItem lua.description:
This is a helper to handle the simplest case of associating one named popup
to one given widget. You can pass a nil str_id to use the identifier of the last
item. This is essentially the same as calling OpenPopupOnItemClick + BeginPopup
but written to avoid computing the ID twice because BeginPopupContext*
functions may be called very frequently.
If you want to use that on a non-interactive item such as Text you need to pass
in an explicit ID here.

ImGui_BeginPopupContextWindow lua.description: Open+begin popup when clicked on current window.

ImGui_BeginPopupModal lua.description:
Block every interaction behind the window, cannot be closed by user, add a
dimming background, has a title bar. Return true if the modal is open, and you
can start outputting to it. See BeginPopup.

ImGui_BeginTabBar lua.description: Create and append into a TabBar.

ImGui_BeginTabItem lua.description:
Create a Tab. Returns true if the Tab is selected.
Set 'p_open' to true to enable the close button.

ImGui_BeginTooltip lua.description:
Begin/append a tooltip window.
To create full-featured tooltip (with any kind of items).

ImGui_Bullet lua.description:
Draw a small circle + keep the cursor on the same line.
Advance cursor x position by GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing,
same distance that TreeNode uses.

ImGui_CalcItemWidth lua.description:
Width of item given pushed settings and current cursor position.
NOT necessarily the width of last item unlike most 'Item' functions.

ImGui_CloseCurrentPopup lua.description:
Manually close the popup we have begin-ed into.
Use inside the BeginPopup/EndPopup scope to close manually.
CloseCurrentPopup() is called by default by Selectable/MenuItem when activated.

ImGui_Col_DockingEmptyBg lua.description: Background color for empty node (e.g. CentralNode with no window docked into it).

ImGui_Col_DockingPreview lua.description: Preview overlay color when about to docking something.

ImGui_Col_FrameBg lua.description: Background of checkbox, radio button, plot, slider, text input.

ImGui_Col_Header lua.description: Header* colors are used for CollapsingHeader, TreeNode, Selectable, MenuItem.

ImGui_Col_ModalWindowDimBg lua.description: Darken/colorize entire screen behind a modal window, when one is active.

ImGui_Col_NavWindowingDimBg lua.description: Darken/colorize entire screen behind the CTRL+TAB window list, when active.

ImGui_Col_PopupBg lua.description: Background of popups, menus, tooltips windows.

ImGui_Col_ResizeGrip lua.description: Resize grip in lower-right and lower-left corners of windows.

ImGui_Col_TableBorderLight lua.description: Table inner borders (prefer using Alpha=1.0 here).

ImGui_Col_TableBorderStrong lua.description: Table outer and header borders (prefer using Alpha=1.0 here).

ImGui_Col_WindowBg lua.description: Background of normal windows. See also WindowFlags_NoBackground.

ImGui_CollapsingHeader lua.description:
Returns true when opened but do not indent nor push into the ID stack
(because of the TreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen flag).
This is basically the same as calling TreeNode(label, TreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader).
You can remove the _NoTreePushOnOpen flag if you want behavior closer to normal
TreeNode.
When 'visible' is provided: if 'true' display an additional small close button
on upper right of the header which will set the bool to false when clicked,
if 'false' don't display the header.

ImGui_ColorButton lua.description:
Display a color square/button, hover for details, return true when pressed.
Color is in 0xRRGGBBAA or, if ColorEditFlags_NoAlpha is set, 0xRRGGBB.

ImGui_ColorConvertDouble4ToU32 lua.description: Pack 0..1 RGBA values into a 32-bit integer (0xRRGGBBAA).

ImGui_ColorConvertNative lua.description:
Convert a native color coming from REAPER or 0xRRGGBB to native.
This swaps the red and blue channels on Windows.

ImGui_ColorConvertU32ToDouble4 lua.description: Unpack a 32-bit integer (0xRRGGBBAA) into separate RGBA values (0..1).

ImGui_ColorEdit3 lua.description: Color is in 0xXXRRGGBB. XX is ignored and will not be modified.

ImGui_ColorEdit4 lua.description:
Color is in 0xRRGGBBAA or, if ColorEditFlags_NoAlpha is set, 0xXXRRGGBB
(XX is ignored and will not be modified).

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_AlphaBar lua.description: ColorEdit, ColorPicker: show vertical alpha bar/gradient in picker.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview lua.description:
ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: display preview as a transparent color
over a checkerboard, instead of opaque.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf lu.description:
ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: display half opaque / half checkerboard,
instead of opaque.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV lua.description:
ColorEdit: override _display_ type to HSV. ColorPicker:
select any combination using one or more of RGB/HSV/Hex.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_DisplayHex lua.description:
ColorEdit: override _display_ type to Hex. ColorPicker:
select any combination using one or more of RGB/HSV/Hex.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB lua.description:
ColorEdit: override _display_ type to RGB. ColorPicker:
select any combination using one or more of RGB/HSV/Hex.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_Float lua.description:
ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0.0..1.0
floats instead of 0..255 integers. No round-trip of value via integers.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_InputHSV lua.description: ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in HSV format.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_InputRGB lua.description: ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in RGB format.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_NoAlpha lua.description:
ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: ignore Alpha component
(will only read 3 components from the input pointer).

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_NoBorder lua.description: ColorButton: disable border (which is enforced by default).

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop lua.description: ColorEdit: disable drag and drop target. ColorButton: disable drag and drop source.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_NoInputs lua.description:
ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable inputs sliders/text widgets
(e.g. to show only the small preview color square).

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_NoLabel lua.description:
ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable display of inline text label
(the label is still forwarded to the tooltip and picker).

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_NoOptions lua.description: ColorEdit: disable toggling options menu when right-clicking on inputs/small preview.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_NoPicker lua.description: ColorEdit: disable picker when clicking on color square.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview lua.description:
ColorPicker: disable bigger color preview on right side of the picker,
use small color square preview instead.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview lua.description:
ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable color square preview next to the inputs.
(e.g. to show only the inputs).

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_NoTooltip lua.description: ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable tooltip when hovering the preview.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar lua.description: ColorPicker: bar for Hue, rectangle for Sat/Value.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel lua.description: ColorPicker: wheel for Hue, triangle for Sat/Value.

ImGui_ColorEditFlags_Uint8 lua.description: ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0..255.

ImGui_ColorPicker3 lua.description: Color is in 0xXXRRGGBB. XX is ignored and will not be modified.

ImGui_Combo lua.description:
Helper over BeginCombo/EndCombo for convenience purpose. Each item must be
null-terminated (requires REAPER v6.44 or newer for EEL and Lua).

ImGui_ComboFlags_HeightLargest lua.description: As many fitting items as possible.

ImGui_ComboFlags_HeightSmall lua.description:
Max ~4 items visible. Tip: If you want your combo popup to be a specific size
you can use SetNextWindowSizeConstraints prior to calling BeginCombo.

ImGui_ComboFlags_NoArrowButton lua.description: Display on the preview box without the square arrow button.

ImGui_ComboFlags_NoPreview lua.description: Display only a square arrow button.

ImGui_ComboFlags_PopupAlignLeft lua.description: Align the popup toward the left by default.

ImGui_Cond_Appearing lua.description:
Set the variable if the object/window is appearing after being
hidden/inactive (or the first time).

ImGui_Cond_FirstUseEver lua.description:
Set the variable if the object/window has no persistently saved data
(no entry in .ini file).

ImGui_Cond_Once lua.description: Set the variable once per runtime session (only the first call will succeed).

ImGui_ConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard lua.description:
Master keyboard navigation enable flag.
Enable full Tabbing + directional arrows + space/enter to activate.

ImGui_ConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos l.description: Instruct navigation to move the mouse cursor.

ImGui_ConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard l.description:
Instruct navigation to not capture global keyboard input when
ConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard is set (see SetNextFrameWantCaptureKeyboard).

ImGui_ConfigFlags_NoMouse lua.description: Instruct imgui to ignore mouse position/buttons.

ImGui_ConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange lu.description: Instruct backend to not alter mouse cursor shape and visibility.

ImGui_ConfigFlags_NoSavedSettings lua.description: Disable state restoration and persistence for the whole context.

ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueLoo.description:
Some calls to Begin()/BeginChild() will return false.
Will cycle through window depths then repeat. Suggested use: add
'SetConfigVar(ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueLoop(), GetKeyMods() == Mod_Shift'
in your main loop then occasionally press SHIFT.
Windows should be flickering while running.

ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueOnc.description:
First-time calls to Begin()/BeginChild() will return false.
**Needs to be set at context startup time** if you don't want to miss windows.

ImGui_ConfigVar_DockingNoSplit lua.description:
Simplified docking mode: disable window splitting, so docking is limited to
merging multiple windows together into tab-bars.

ImGui_ConfigVar_DockingTransparentPayloa.description:
Make window or viewport transparent when docking and only display docking
boxes on the target viewport.

ImGui_ConfigVar_DockingWithShift lua.description:
Enable docking with holding Shift key
(reduce visual noise, allows dropping in wider space

ImGui_ConfigVar_DragClickToInputText lua.description:
Enable turning Drag* widgets into text input with a simple mouse
click-release (without moving). Not desirable on devices without a keyboard.

ImGui_ConfigVar_HoverDelayNormal lua.description: Delay on hovering before IsItemHovered(HoveredFlags_DelayNormal) returns true.

ImGui_ConfigVar_HoverDelayShort lua.description: Delay on hovering before IsItemHovered(HoveredFlags_DelayShort) returns true.

ImGui_ConfigVar_InputTextCursorBlink lua.description: Enable blinking cursor (optional as some users consider it to be distracting).

ImGui_ConfigVar_InputTextEnterKeepActive.description: Pressing Enter will keep item active and select contents (single-line only).

ImGui_ConfigVar_InputTrickleEventQueue l.description:
Enable input queue trickling: some types of events submitted during the same
frame (e.g. button down + up) will be spread over multiple frames, improving
interactions with low framerates.
Warning: when this option is disabled mouse clicks and key presses faster
than a frame will be lost.
This affects accessiblity features and some input devices.

ImGui_ConfigVar_KeyRepeatDelay lua.description:
When holding a key/button, time before it starts repeating, in seconds
(for buttons in Repeat mode, etc.).

ImGui_ConfigVar_KeyRepeatRate lua.description: When holding a key/button, rate at which it repeats, in seconds.

ImGui_ConfigVar_MacOSXBehaviors lua.description:
OS X style: Text editing cursor movement using Alt instead of Ctrl, Shortcuts
using Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl, Line/Text Start and End using Cmd+Arrows
instead of Home/End, Double click selects by word instead of selecting whole
text, Multi-selection in lists uses Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl.

ImGui_ConfigVar_MouseDoubleClickMaxDist.description: Distance threshold to stay in to validate a double-click, in pixels.

ImGui_ConfigVar_MouseDoubleClickTime lua.description: Time for a double-click, in seconds.

ImGui_ConfigVar_MouseDragThreshold lua.description: Distance threshold before considering we are dragging.

ImGui_ConfigVar_ViewportsNoDecoration lu.description:
Disable default OS window decoration. Enabling decoration can create
subsequent issues at OS levels (e.g. minimum window size).

ImGui_ConfigVar_WindowsMoveFromTitleBarO.description:
Enable allowing to move windows only when clicking on their title bar.
Does not apply to windows without a title bar.

ImGui_ConfigVar_WindowsResizeFromEdges l.description: Enable resizing of windows from their edges and from the lower-left corner.

ImGui_CreateContext lua.description:
Create a new ReaImGui context.
The context will remain valid as long as it is used in each defer cycle.
The label is used for the tab text when windows are docked in REAPER
and also as a unique identifier for storing settings.

ImGui_CreateFont lua.description:
Load a font matching a font family name or from a font file.
The font will remain valid while it's attached to a context. See Attach.
The family name can be an installed font or one of the generic fonts:
sans-serif, serif, monospace, cursive, fantasy.
If 'family_or_file' specifies a path to a font file (contains a / or \):
- The first byte of 'flags' is used as the font index within the file
- The font styles in 'flags' are simulated by the font renderer

ImGui_CreateFunctionFromEEL lua.description:
Compile an EEL program.
Standard EEL [math](https://www.r.fm/sdk/js/basiccode.php#js_basicfunc)
and [string](https://www.r.fm/sdk/js/strings.php#js_string_funcs)
functions are available in addition to callback-specific functions
(see InputTextCallback_*).

ImGui_CreateImage lua.description:
The returned object is valid as long as it is used in each defer cycle
unless attached to a context (see Attach).
('flags' currently unused and reserved for future expansion)

ImGui_CreateImageFromMem lua.description:
Requires REAPER v6.44 or newer for EEL and Lua. Load from a file using
CreateImage or explicitely specify data_sz if supporting older versions.

ImGui_CreateListClipper lua.description:
The returned clipper object is only valid for the given context and is valid
as long as it is used in each defer cycle unless attached (see Attach).

ImGui_CreateTextFilter lua.description: Valid while used every frame unless attached to a context (see Attach).

ImGui_DebugTextEncoding lua.description:
Helper tool to diagnose between text encoding issues and font loading issues.
Pass your UTF-8 string and verify that there are correct.

ImGui_Detach lua.description:
Unlink the object's lifetime. Unattached objects are automatically destroyed
when left unused. You may check whether an object has been destroyed using
ValidatePtr.

ImGui_DragDouble4 lua.body: rv, v1, v2, v3, v4 = ImGui.DragDouble4(${1:ctx}, ${2:label}, ${3:v1}, ${4:v2}, ${5:v3}, ${6:v4}, ${7:optional_v_speedIn}, ${8:optional_v_minIn}, ${9:optional_v_maxIn}, ${10:optional_formatIn}, ${11:optional_flagsIn})$0

ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery.description:
AcceptDragDropPayload will returns true even before the mouse button is
released. You can then check GetDragDropPayload/is_delivery to test if the
payload needs to be delivered.

ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultR.description: Do not draw the default highlight rectangle when hovering over target.

ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewToolt.description: Request hiding the BeginDragDropSource tooltip from the BeginDragDropTarget site.

ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptPeekOnly lua.description:
For peeking ahead and inspecting the payload before delivery.
Equivalent to DragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery |
DragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect.

ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID lu.description:
Allow items such as Text, Image that have no unique identifier to be used as
drag source, by manufacturing a temporary identifier based on their
window-relative position. This is extremely unusual within the dear imgui
ecosystem and so we made it explicit.

ImGui_DragDropFlags_PayloadAutoExpire lu.description:
Automatically expire the payload if the source cease to be submitted
(otherwise payloads are persisting while being dragged).

ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceExtern lua.description:
External source (from outside of dear imgui), won't attempt to read current
item/window info. Will always return true.
Only one Extern source can be active simultaneously.

ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover.description:
By default, when dragging we clear data so that IsItemHovered will return
false, to avoid subsequent user code submitting tooltips. This flag disables
this behavior so you can still call IsItemHovered on the source item.

ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOt.description:
Disable the behavior that allows to open tree nodes and collapsing header by
holding over them while dragging a source item.

ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewToolt.description:
By default, a successful call to BeginDragDropSource opens a tooltip so you
can display a preview or description of the source contents.
This flag disables this behavior.

ImGui_DragInt4 lua.body: rv, v1, v2, v3, v4 = ImGui.DragInt4(${1:ctx}, ${2:label}, ${3:v1}, ${4:v2}, ${5:v3}, ${6:v4}, ${7:optional_v_speedIn}, ${8:optional_v_minIn}, ${9:optional_v_maxIn}, ${10:optional_formatIn}, ${11:optional_flagsIn})$0

ImGui_DrawFlags_Closed lua.description:
DrawList_PathStroke, DrawList_AddPolyline: specify that shape should be
closed (Important: this is always == 1 for legacy reason).

ImGui_DrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft l.description:
DrawList_AddRect, DrawList_AddRectFilled, DrawList_PathRect: enable rounding
bottom-left corner only (when rounding > 0.0, we default to all corners).

ImGui_DrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight.description:
DrawList_AddRect, DrawList_AddRectFilled, DrawList_PathRect: enable rounding
bottom-right corner only (when rounding > 0.0, we default to all corners).

ImGui_DrawFlags_RoundCornersNone lua.description:
DrawList_AddRect, DrawList_AddRectFilled, DrawList_PathRect: disable rounding
on all corners (when rounding > 0.0). This is NOT zero, NOT an implicit flag!.

ImGui_DrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft lua.description:
DrawList_AddRect, DrawList_AddRectFilled, DrawList_PathRect: enable rounding
top-left corner only (when rounding > 0.0, we default to all corners).

ImGui_DrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight lua.description:
DrawList_AddRect, DrawList_AddRectFilled, DrawList_PathRect: enable rounding
top-right corner only (when rounding > 0.0, we default to all corners).

ImGui_DrawList_AddConvexPolyFilled lua.description: Note: Anti-aliased filling requires points to be in clockwise order.

ImGui_DrawList_AddPolyline lua.description: Points is a list of x,y coordinates.

ImGui_DrawList_AddTextEx lua.description:
The last pushed font is used if font is nil.
The size of the last pushed font is used if font_size is 0.
cpu_fine_clip_rect_* only takes effect if all four are non-nil.

ImGui_DrawList_PathArcToFast lua.description: Use precomputed angles for a 12 steps circle.

ImGui_DrawList_PathFillConvex lua.description: Note: Anti-aliased filling requires points to be in clockwise order.

ImGui_DrawList_PushClipRect lua.description:
Render-level scissoring. Prefer using higher-level PushClipRect to affect
logic (hit-testing and widget culling).

ImGui_Dummy lua.description:
Add a dummy item of given size. unlike InvisibleButton, Dummy() won't take the
mouse click or be navigable into.

ImGui_End lua.description: Pop window from the stack. See Begin.

ImGui_EndCombo lua.description: Only call EndCombo() if BeginCombo returns true!

ImGui_EndDragDropSource lua.description: Only call EndDragDropSource() if BeginDragDropSource returns true!

ImGui_EndDragDropTarget lua.description: Only call EndDragDropTarget() if BeginDragDropTarget returns true!

ImGui_EndGroup lua.description:
Unlock horizontal starting position + capture the whole group bounding box
into one 'item' (so you can use IsItemHovered or layout primitives such as
SameLine on whole group, etc.).
See BeginGroup.

ImGui_EndListBox lua.description: Only call EndListBox() if BeginListBox returned true!

ImGui_EndMenu lua.description: Only call EndMenu() if BeginMenu returns true!

ImGui_EndMenuBar lua.description: Only call EndMenuBar if BeginMenuBar returns true!

ImGui_EndPopup lua.description: Only call EndPopup() if BeginPopup*() returns true!

ImGui_EndTabBar lua.description: Only call EndTabBar() if BeginTabBar() returns true!

ImGui_EndTabItem lua.description: Only call EndTabItem() if BeginTabItem() returns true!

ImGui_EndTable lua.description: Only call EndTable() if BeginTable() returns true!

ImGui_EndTooltip lua.description: Only call EndTooltip() if BeginTooltip() returns true.

ImGui_FocusedFlags_AnyWindow lua.description: Return true if any window is focused.

ImGui_FocusedFlags_ChildWindows lua.description: Return true if any children of the window is focused.

ImGui_FocusedFlags_DockHierarchy lua.description:
Consider docking hierarchy (treat dockspace host as parent of docked window)
(when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow).

ImGui_FocusedFlags_NoPopupHierarchy lua.description:
Do not consider popup hierarchy (do not treat popup emitter as parent of
popup) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow).

ImGui_FocusedFlags_RootWindow lua.description: Test from root window (top most parent of the current hierarchy).

ImGui_Function_GetValue_Array lua.description:
Copy the values in the function's memory starting at the address stored
in the given variable into the array.

ImGui_Function_GetValue_String lua.description: Read from a string slot or a named string (when name starts with a `#`).

ImGui_Function_SetValue_Array lua.description:
Copy the values in the array to the function's memory at the address stored
in the given variable.

ImGui_Function_SetValue_String lua.description: Write to a string slot or a named string (when name starts with a `#`).

ImGui_GetBackgroundDrawList lua.description:
This draw list will be the first rendering one. Useful to quickly draw
shapes/text behind dear imgui contents.

ImGui_GetColor lua.description:
Retrieve given style color with style alpha applied and optional extra alpha
multiplier, packed as a 32-bit value (RGBA). See Col_* for available style colors.

ImGui_GetColorEx lua.description: Retrieve given color with style alpha applied, packed as a 32-bit value (RGBA).

ImGui_GetContentRegionMax lua.description:
Current content boundaries (typically window boundaries including scrolling,
or current column boundaries), in windows coordinates.

ImGui_GetCursorScreenPos lua.description: Cursor position in absolute screen coordinates (useful to work with the DrawList API).

ImGui_GetCursorStartPos lua.description: Initial cursor position in window coordinates.

ImGui_GetDeltaTime lua.description: Time elapsed since last frame, in seconds.

ImGui_GetDragDropPayload lua.body: rv, type, payload, is_preview, is_delivery = ImGui.GetDragDropPayload(${1:ctx})$0
ImGui_GetDragDropPayload lua.description: Peek directly into the current payload from anywhere.

ImGui_GetDragDropPayloadFile lua.description:
Get a filename from the list of dropped files.
Returns false if index is out of bounds.

ImGui_GetFontSize lua.description:
Get current font size (= height in pixels) of current font with current scale
applied.

ImGui_GetForegroundDrawList lua.description:
This draw list will be the last rendered one. Useful to quickly draw
shapes/text over dear imgui contents.

ImGui_GetFrameCount lua.description: Get global imgui frame count. incremented by 1 every frame.

ImGui_GetFrameHeightWithSpacing lua.description:
GetFontSize + StyleVar_FramePadding.y * 2 + StyleVar_ItemSpacing.y
(distance in pixels between 2 consecutive lines of framed widgets).

ImGui_GetFramerate lua.description:
Estimate of application framerate (rolling average over 60 frames, based on
GetDeltaTime), in frame per second. Solely for convenience.

ImGui_GetInputQueueCharacter lua.description:
Read from ImGui's character input queue.
Call with increasing idx until false is returned.

ImGui_GetItemRectMax lua.description: Get lower-right bounding rectangle of the last item (screen space)

ImGui_GetItemRectMin lua.description: Get upper-left bounding rectangle of the last item (screen space)

ImGui_GetKeyDownDuration lua.description: Duration the keyboard key has been down (0.0 == just pressed)

ImGui_GetKeyMods lua.description: Flags for the Ctrl/Shift/Alt/Super keys. Uses Mod_* values.

ImGui_GetKeyPressedAmount lua.description:
Uses provided repeat rate/delay. Return a count, most often 0 or 1 but might
be >1 if ConfigVar_RepeatRate is small enough that GetDeltaTime > RepeatRate.

ImGui_GetMainViewport lua.description:
Currently represents REAPER's main window (arrange view).
WARNING: This may change or be removed in the future.

ImGui_GetMouseClickedCount lua.description: Return the number of successive mouse-clicks at the time where a click happen (otherwise 0).

ImGui_GetMouseCursor lua.description: Get desired mouse cursor shape, reset every frame. This is updated during the frame.

ImGui_GetMouseDelta lua.description:
Mouse delta. Note that this is zero if either current or previous position
are invalid (-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX), so a disappearing/reappearing mouse won't have
a huge delta.

ImGui_GetMouseDownDuration lua.description: Duration the mouse button has been down (0.0 == just clicked)

ImGui_GetMouseDragDelta lua.description:
Return the delta from the initial clicking position while the mouse button is
pressed or was just released. This is locked and return 0.0 until the mouse
moves past a distance threshold at least once (if lock_threshold < -1.0, uses
ConfigVar_MouseDragThreshold).

ImGui_GetMousePosOnOpeningCurrentPopup l.description:
Retrieve mouse position at the time of opening popup we have BeginPopup()
into (helper to avoid user backing that value themselves).

ImGui_GetMouseWheel lua.description:
Vertical: 1 unit scrolls about 5 lines text. >0 scrolls Up, <0 scrolls Down.
Hold SHIFT to turn vertical scroll into horizontal scroll
Horizontal: >0 scrolls Left, <0 scrolls Right.
Most users don't have a mouse with a horizontal wheel.

ImGui_GetScrollMaxX lua.description: Get maximum scrolling amount ~~ ContentSize.x - WindowSize.x - DecorationsSize.x

ImGui_GetScrollMaxY lua.description: Get maximum scrolling amount ~~ ContentSize.y - WindowSize.y - DecorationsSize.y

ImGui_GetStyleColor lua.description:
Retrieve style color as stored in ImGuiStyle structure.
Use to feed back into PushStyleColor, Otherwise use GetColor to get style color
with style alpha baked in. See Col_* for available style colors.

ImGui_GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing lua.description:
GetFontSize + StyleVar_ItemSpacing.y
(distance in pixels between 2 consecutive lines of text).

ImGui_GetTime lua.description: Get global imgui time. Incremented every frame.

ImGui_GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing lua.description:
Horizontal distance preceding label when using TreeNode*() or Bullet()
== (GetFontSize + StyleVar_FramePadding.x*2) for a regular unframed TreeNode.

ImGui_GetWindowContentRegionMax lua.description:
Content boundaries max (roughly (0,0)+Size-Scroll) where Size can be
overridden with SetNextWindowContentSize, in window coordinates.

ImGui_GetWindowContentRegionMin lua.description: Content boundaries min (roughly (0,0)-Scroll), in window coordinates.

ImGui_GetWindowDpiScale lua.description:
Get DPI scale currently associated to the current window's viewport
(1.0 = 96 DPI).

ImGui_GetWindowDrawList lua.description: The draw list associated to the current window, to append your own drawing primitives

ImGui_GetWindowHeight lua.description: Get current window height (shortcut for (select(2, GetWindowSize())).

ImGui_GetWindowPos lua.description:
Get current window position in screen space (useful if you want to do your own
drawing via the DrawList API).

ImGui_GetWindowViewport lua.description: Get viewport currently associated to the current window.

ImGui_GetWindowWidth lua.description: Get current window width (shortcut for (select(1, GetWindowSize())).

ImGui_HoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByAct.description:
Return true even if an active item is blocking access to this item/window.
Useful for Drag and Drop patterns.

ImGui_HoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPop.description: Return true even if a popup window is normally blocking access to this item/window.

ImGui_HoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled lua.description: IsItemHovered only: Return true even if the item is disabled.

ImGui_HoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped l.description:
IsItemHovered only: Return true even if the position is obstructed or
overlapped by another window.

ImGui_HoveredFlags_AnyWindow lua.description: IsWindowHovered only: Return true if any window is hovered.

ImGui_HoveredFlags_ChildWindows lua.description: IsWindowHovered only: Return true if any children of the window is hovered.

ImGui_HoveredFlags_DelayNormal lua.description: Return true after ConfigVar_HoverDelayNormal elapsed (~0.30 sec)

ImGui_HoveredFlags_DelayShort lua.description: Return true after ConfigVar_HoverDelayShort elapsed (~0.10 sec)

ImGui_HoveredFlags_DockHierarchy lua.description:
IsWindowHovered only: Consider docking hierarchy (treat dockspace host as
parent of docked window) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow).

ImGui_HoveredFlags_NoNavOverride lua.description: Disable using gamepad/keyboard navigation state when active, always query mouse.

ImGui_HoveredFlags_NoPopupHierarchy lua.description:
IsWindowHovered only: Do not consider popup hierarchy (do not treat popup
emitter as parent of popup) (when used with _ChildWindows or _RootWindow).

ImGui_HoveredFlags_NoSharedDelay lua.description:
Disable shared delay system where moving from one item to the next keeps
the previous timer for a short time (standard for tooltips with long delays

ImGui_HoveredFlags_None lua.description:
Return true if directly over the item/window, not obstructed by another
window, not obstructed by an active popup or modal blocking inputs under them.

ImGui_HoveredFlags_RootWindow lua.description: IsWindowHovered only: Test from root window (top most parent of the current hierarchy).

ImGui_Indent lua.description:
Move content position toward the right, by 'indent_w', or
StyleVar_IndentSpacing if 'indent_w' <= 0. See Unindent.

ImGui_InputDouble4 lua.body: rv, v1, v2, v3, v4 = ImGui.InputDouble4(${1:ctx}, ${2:label}, ${3:v1}, ${4:v2}, ${5:v3}, ${6:v4}, ${7:optional_formatIn}, ${8:optional_flagsIn})$0

ImGui_InputInt4 lua.body: rv, v1, v2, v3, v4 = ImGui.InputInt4(${1:ctx}, ${2:label}, ${3:v1}, ${4:v2}, ${5:v3}, ${6:v4}, ${7:optional_flagsIn})$0

ImGui_InputTextFlags_AllowTabInput lua.description: Pressing TAB input a '	' character into the text field.

ImGui_InputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll lua.description: Select entire text when first taking mouse focus.

ImGui_InputTextFlags_CallbackAlways lua.description: Callback on each iteration. User code may query cursor position, modify text buffer.

ImGui_InputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter.description:
Callback on character inputs to replace or discard them.
Modify 'EventChar' to replace or 'EventChar = 0' to discard.

ImGui_InputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion.description: Callback on pressing TAB (for completion handling).

ImGui_InputTextFlags_CallbackEdit lua.description:
Callback on any edit (note that InputText() already returns true on edit,
the callback is useful mainly to manipulate the underlying buffer while
focus is active).

ImGui_InputTextFlags_CallbackHistory lua.description: Callback on pressing Up/Down arrows (for history handling).

ImGui_InputTextFlags_CtrlEnterForNewLine.description:
In multi-line mode, unfocus with Enter, add new line with Ctrl+Enter
(default is opposite: unfocus with Ctrl+Enter, add line with Enter).

ImGui_InputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue lu.description:
Return 'true' when Enter is pressed (as opposed to every time the value was
modified). Consider looking at the IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit function.

ImGui_InputTextFlags_EscapeClearsAll lua.description:
Escape key clears content if not empty, and deactivate otherwise
(constrast to default behavior of Escape to revert).

ImGui_InputTextFlags_NoUndoRedo lua.description: Disable undo/redo. Note that input text owns the text data while active.

ImGui_InputTextFlags_Password lua.description: Password mode, display all characters as '*'.

ImGui_InvisibleButton lua.description:
Flexible button behavior without the visuals, frequently useful to build
custom behaviors using the public api (along with IsItemActive, IsItemHovered, etc.).

ImGui_IsItemActivated lua.description: Was the last item just made active (item was previously inactive).

ImGui_IsItemActive lua.description:
Is the last item active? (e.g. button being held, text field being edited.
This will continuously return true while holding mouse button on an item.
Items that don't interact will always return false.

ImGui_IsItemClicked lua.description:
Is the last item clicked? (e.g. button/node just clicked on)
== IsMouseClicked(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered().
This is NOT equivalent to the behavior of e.g. Button.
Most widgets have specific reactions based on mouse-up/down state, mouse position etc.

ImGui_IsItemDeactivated lua.description:
Was the last item just made inactive (item was previously active).
Useful for Undo/Redo patterns with widgets that require continuous editing.

ImGui_IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit lua.description:
Was the last item just made inactive and made a value change when it was
active? (e.g. Slider/Drag moved).
Useful for Undo/Redo patterns with widgets that require continuous editing. Note
that you may get false positives (some widgets such as Combo/ListBox/Selectable
will return true even when clicking an already selected item).

ImGui_IsItemEdited lua.description:
Did the last item modify its underlying value this frame? or was pressed?
This is generally the same as the 'bool' return value of many widgets.

ImGui_IsItemFocused lua.description: Is the last item focused for keyboard/gamepad navigation?

ImGui_IsItemHovered lua.description:
Is the last item hovered? (and usable, aka not blocked by a popup, etc.).
See HoveredFlags_* for more options.

ImGui_IsItemToggledOpen lua.description: Was the last item open state toggled? Set by TreeNode.

ImGui_IsItemVisible lua.description: Is the last item visible? (items may be out of sight because of clipping/scrolling)

ImGui_IsKeyPressed lua.description:
Was key pressed (went from !Down to Down)?
If repeat=true, uses ConfigVar_KeyRepeatDelay / ConfigVar_KeyRepeatRate.

ImGui_IsKeyReleased lua.description: Was key released (went from Down to !Down)?

ImGui_IsMouseClicked lua.description:
Did mouse button clicked? (went from !Down to Down).
Same as GetMouseClickedCount() == 1.

ImGui_IsMouseDoubleClicked lua.description:
Did mouse button double-clicked? Same as GetMouseClickedCount() == 2.
(Note that a double-click will also report IsMouseClicked() == true)

ImGui_IsMouseDragging lua.description: Is mouse dragging? (if lock_threshold < -1.0, uses ConfigVar_MouseDragThreshold)

ImGui_IsMouseHoveringRect lua.description:
Is mouse hovering given bounding rect (in screen space).
Clipped by current clipping settings, but disregarding of other consideration
of focus/window ordering/popup-block.

ImGui_IsMouseReleased lua.description: Did mouse button released? (went from Down to !Down)

ImGui_IsPopupOpen lua.description:
Return true if the popup is open at the current BeginPopup level of the
popup stack.
- With PopupFlags_AnyPopupId: return true if any popup is open at the current
BeginPopup() level of the popup stack.
- With PopupFlags_AnyPopupId + PopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel: return true if any
popup is open.

ImGui_IsRectVisible lua.description:
Test if rectangle (of given size, starting from cursor position) is
visible / not clipped.

ImGui_IsRectVisibleEx lua.description:
Test if rectangle (in screen space) is visible / not clipped. to perform
coarse clipping on user's side.

ImGui_IsWindowAppearing lua.description: Use after Begin/BeginPopup/BeginPopupModal to tell if a window just opened.

ImGui_IsWindowDocked lua.description: Is current window docked into another window or a REAPER docker?

ImGui_IsWindowFocused lua.description:
Is current window focused? or its root/child, depending on flags.
See flags for options.

ImGui_IsWindowHovered lua.description:
Is current window hovered (and typically: not blocked by a popup/modal)?
See flags for options.

ImGui_LabelText lua.description: Display text+label aligned the same way as value+label widgets

ImGui_ListBox lua.description:
This is an helper over BeginListBox/EndListBox for convenience purpose.
Each item must be null-terminated (requires REAPER v6.44 or newer for EEL and Lua).

ImGui_ListClipper_Begin lua.description:
- items_count: Use INT_MAX if you don't know how many items you have
(in which case the cursor won't be advanced in the final step)
- items_height: Use -1.0 to be calculated automatically on first step.
Otherwise pass in the distance between your items, typically
GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing or GetFrameHeightWithSpacing.

ImGui_ListClipper_End lua.description: Automatically called on the last call of ListClipper_Step that returns false.

ImGui_ListClipper_ForceDisplayRangeByInd.description:
Call ListClipper_ForceDisplayRangeByIndices before first call to
ListClipper_Step if you need a range of items to be displayed regardless of
visibility.
item_max is exclusive e.g. use (42, 42+1) to make item 42 always visible BUT due
to alignment/padding of certain items it is likely that an extra item may be
included on either end of the display range.

ImGui_ListClipper_Step lua.description:
Call until it returns false. The display_start/display_end fields from
ListClipper_GetDisplayRange will be set and you can process/draw those items.

ImGui_LogText lua.description: Pass text data straight to log (without being displayed)

ImGui_LogToClipboard lua.description:
Start logging all text output from the interface to the OS clipboard.
See also SetClipboardText.

ImGui_LogToFile lua.description:
Start logging all text output from the interface to a file.
The data is saved to $resource_path/imgui_log.txt if filename is nil.

ImGui_LogToTTY lua.description: Start logging all text output from the interface to the TTY (stdout).

ImGui_MenuItem lua.description:
Return true when activated. Shortcuts are displayed for convenience but not
processed by ImGui at the moment. Toggle state is written to 'selected' when
provided.

ImGui_MouseCursor_Hand lua.description: (Unused by Dear ImGui functions. Use for e.g. hyperlinks)

ImGui_MouseCursor_NotAllowed lua.description: When hovering something with disallowed interaction. Usually a crossed circle.

ImGui_MouseCursor_ResizeEW lua.description: When hovering over a vertical border or a column.

ImGui_MouseCursor_ResizeNESW lua.description: When hovering over the bottom-left corner of a window.

ImGui_MouseCursor_ResizeNS lua.description: When hovering over a horizontal border.

ImGui_MouseCursor_ResizeNWSE lua.description: When hovering over the bottom-right corner of a window.

ImGui_NewLine lua.description: Undo a SameLine() or force a new line when in a horizontal-layout context.

ImGui_NumericLimits_Double lua.description: Returns DBL_MIN and DBL_MAX for this system.

ImGui_NumericLimits_Float lua.description: Returns FLT_MIN and FLT_MAX for this system.

ImGui_NumericLimits_Int lua.description: Returns INT_MIN and INT_MAX for this system.

ImGui_OpenPopup lua.description:
Set popup state to open (don't call every frame!).
ImGuiPopupFlags are available for opening options.
If not modal: they can be closed by clicking anywhere outside them, or by
pressing ESCAPE.
Use PopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup to avoid opening a popup if there's
already one at the same level.

ImGui_OpenPopupOnItemClick lua.description:
Helper to open popup when clicked on last item. return true when just opened.
(Note: actually triggers on the mouse _released_ event to be consistent with
popup behaviors.)

ImGui_PointConvertNative lua.description:
Convert a position from the current platform's native coordinate position
system to ReaImGui global coordinates (or vice versa).
This effectively flips the Y coordinate on macOS and applies HiDPI scaling on
Windows and Linux.

ImGui_PopupFlags_AnyPopupId lua.description: For IsPopupOpen: ignore the str_id parameter and test for any popup.

ImGui_PopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel lua.description:
For IsPopupOpen: search/test at any level of the popup stack
(default test in the current level).

ImGui_PopupFlags_MouseButtonLeft lua.description:
For BeginPopupContext*(): open on Left Mouse release.
Guaranteed to always be == 0 (same as MouseButton_Left).

ImGui_PopupFlags_MouseButtonMiddle lua.description:
For BeginPopupContext*(): open on Middle Mouse release.
Guaranteed to always be == 2 (same as MouseButton_Middle).

ImGui_PopupFlags_MouseButtonRight lua.description:
For BeginPopupContext*(): open on Right Mouse release.
Guaranteed to always be == 1 (same as MouseButton_Right).

ImGui_PopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup.description:
For OpenPopup*(), BeginPopupContext*(): don't open if there's already a popup
at the same level of the popup stack.

ImGui_PopupFlags_NoOpenOverItems lua.description:
For BeginPopupContextWindow: don't return true when hovering items,
only when hovering empty space.

ImGui_PushButtonRepeat lua.description:
In 'repeat' mode, Button*() functions return repeated true in a typematic
manner (using ConfigVar_KeyRepeatDelay/ConfigVar_KeyRepeatRate settings).
Note that you can call IsItemActive after any Button to tell if the button is
held in the current frame.

ImGui_PushFont lua.description:
Change the current font. Use nil to push the default font.
The font object must have been registered using Attach. See PopFont.

ImGui_PushID lua.description: Push string into the ID stack.

ImGui_PushItemWidth lua.description:
Push width of items for common large 'item+label' widgets.
- >0.0: width in pixels
- <0.0 align xx pixels to the right of window
(so -FLT_MIN always align width to the right side)
- 0.0 = default to ~2/3 of windows width.

ImGui_PushStyleColor lua.description:
Temporarily modify a style color.
Call PopStyleColor to undo after use (before the end of the frame).
See Col_* for available style colors.

ImGui_PushStyleVar lua.description:
Temporarily modify a style variable.
Call PopStyleVar to undo after use (before the end of the frame).
See StyleVar_* for possible values of 'var_idx'.

ImGui_PushTabStop lua.description:
Allow focusing using TAB/Shift-TAB, enabled by default but you can disable it
for certain widgets

ImGui_PushTextWrapPos lua.description:
Push word-wrapping position for Text*() commands.
-  < 0.0: no wrapping
-  = 0.0: wrap to end of window (or column)
- > 0.0: wrap at 'wrap_pos_x' position in window local space.

ImGui_RadioButton lua.description: Use with e.g. if (RadioButton('one', my_value==1)) { my_value = 1; }

ImGui_RadioButtonEx lua.description: Shortcut to handle RadioButton's example pattern when value is an integer

ImGui_SameLine lua.description:
Call between widgets or groups to layout them horizontally. X position given in window coordinates. 

Parameters:
- ctx (mandatory)
- optional_offset_from_start_xIn (optional)
- optional_spacingIn (optional)

ImGui_SelectableFlags_AllowDoubleClick l.description: Generate press events on double clicks too.

ImGui_SelectableFlags_AllowOverlap lua.description: Hit testing to allow subsequent widgets to overlap this one.

ImGui_SelectableFlags_Disabled lua.description: Cannot be selected, display grayed out text.

ImGui_SelectableFlags_DontClosePopups lu.description: Clicking this doesn't close parent popup window.

ImGui_SelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns lua.description: Selectable frame can span all columns (text will still fit in current column).

ImGui_Separator lua.description:
Separator, generally horizontal. inside a menu bar or in horizontal layout
mode, this becomes a vertical separator.

ImGui_SeparatorText lua.description: Text formatted with an horizontal line

ImGui_SetClipboardText lua.description:
See also the LogToClipboard function to capture GUI into clipboard,
or easily output text data to the clipboard.

ImGui_SetColorEditOptions lua.description:
Picker type, etc. User will be able to change many settings, unless you pass
the _NoOptions flag to your calls.

ImGui_SetCursorScreenPos lua.description: Cursor position in absolute screen coordinates.

ImGui_SetDragDropPayload lua.description:
The type is a user defined string of maximum 32 characters.
Strings starting with '_' are reserved for dear imgui internal types.
Data is copied and held by imgui.

ImGui_SetNextItemAllowOverlap lua.description:
Allow last item to be overlapped by a subsequent item. sometimes useful with
invisible buttons, selectables, etc. to catch unused area.

ImGui_SetItemDefaultFocus lua.description: Make last item the default focused item of a window.

ImGui_SetKeyboardFocusHere lua.description:
Focus keyboard on the next widget. Use positive 'offset' to access sub
components of a multiple component widget. Use -1 to access previous widget.

ImGui_SetMouseCursor lua.description: Set desired mouse cursor shape. See MouseCursor_* for possible values.

ImGui_SetNextFrameWantCaptureKeyboard lu.description: Request capture of keyboard shortcuts in REAPER's global scope for the next frame.

ImGui_SetNextItemOpen lua.description:
Set next TreeNode/CollapsingHeader open state.
Can also be done with the TreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen flag.

ImGui_SetNextItemWidth lua.description:
Set width of the _next_ common large 'item+label' widget.
- >0.0: width in pixels
- <0.0 align xx pixels to the right of window
(so -FLT_MIN always align width to the right side)

ImGui_SetNextWindowBgAlpha lua.description:
Set next window background color alpha. Helper to easily override the Alpha
component of Col_WindowBg/Col_ChildBg/Col_PopupBg.
You may also use WindowFlags_NoBackground for a fully transparent window.

ImGui_SetNextWindowContentSize lua.description:
Set next window content size (~ scrollable client area, which enforce the
range of scrollbars). Not including window decorations (title bar, menu bar,
etc.) nor StyleVar_WindowPadding. set an axis to 0.0 to leave it automatic.

ImGui_SetNextWindowFocus lua.description: Set next window to be focused / top-most.

ImGui_SetNextWindowPos lua.description: Set next window position. Use pivot=(0.5,0.5) to center on given point, etc.

ImGui_SetNextWindowScroll lua.description: Set next window scrolling value (use < 0.0 to not affect a given axis).

ImGui_SetNextWindowSize lua.description: Set next window size. set axis to 0.0 to force an auto-fit on this axis.

ImGui_SetNextWindowSizeConstraints lua.description:
Set next window size limits. Use -1,-1 on either X/Y axis to preserve the
current size. Use FLT_MAX (second return value of NumericLimits_Float) for no
maximum size. Sizes will be rounded down.

ImGui_SetScrollFromPosX lua.description:
Adjust scrolling amount to make given position visible.
Generally GetCursorStartPos() + offset to compute a valid position.

ImGui_SetScrollFromPosY lua.description:
Adjust scrolling amount to make given position visible.
Generally GetCursorStartPos() + offset to compute a valid position.

ImGui_SetScrollHereX lua.description:
Adjust scrolling amount to make current cursor position visible.
center_x_ratio=0.0: left, 0.5: center, 1.0: right.
When using to make a 'default/current item' visible,
consider using SetItemDefaultFocus instead.

ImGui_SetScrollHereY lua.description:
Adjust scrolling amount to make current cursor position visible.
center_y_ratio=0.0: top, 0.5: center, 1.0: bottom.
When using to make a 'default/current item' visible,
consider using SetItemDefaultFocus instead.

ImGui_SetTabItemClosed lua.description:
Notify TabBar or Docking system of a closed tab/window ahead
(useful to reduce visual flicker on reorderable tab bars).
For tab-bar: call after BeginTabBar and before Tab submissions.
Otherwise call with a window name.

ImGui_SetTooltip lua.description:
Set a text-only tooltip, typically use with IsItemHovered. override any
previous call to SetTooltip.

ImGui_SetWindowCollapsed lua.description:
(Not recommended) Set current window collapsed state.
Prefer using SetNextWindowCollapsed.

ImGui_SetWindowFocus lua.description:
(Not recommended) Set current window to be focused / top-most.
Prefer using SetNextWindowFocus.

ImGui_SetWindowFocusEx lua.description: Set named window to be focused / top-most. Use an empty name to remove focus.

ImGui_SetWindowPos lua.description:
(Not recommended) Set current window position - call within Begin/End.
Prefer using SetNextWindowPos, as this may incur tearing and minor side-effects.

ImGui_SetWindowSize lua.description:
(Not recommended) Set current window size - call within Begin/End.
Set size_w and size_h to 0 to force an auto-fit.
Prefer using SetNextWindowSize, as this may incur tearing and minor side-effects.

ImGui_SetWindowSizeEx lua.description: Set named window size. Set axis to 0.0 to force an auto-fit on this axis.

ImGui_ShowAboutWindow lua.description:
Create About window.
Display ReaImGui version, Dear ImGui version, credits and build/system information.

ImGui_ShowDebugLogWindow lua.description: Create Debug Log window. display a simplified log of important dear imgui events.

ImGui_ShowMetricsWindow lua.description:
Create Metrics/Debugger window.
Display Dear ImGui internals: windows, draw commands, various internal state, etc.

ImGui_ShowStackToolWindow lua.description:
Create Stack Tool window. Hover items with mouse to query information about
the source of their unique ID.

ImGui_SliderDouble4 lua.body: rv, v1, v2, v3, v4 = ImGui.SliderDouble4(${1:ctx}, ${2:label}, ${3:v1}, ${4:v2}, ${5:v3}, ${6:v4}, ${7:v_min}, ${8:v_max}, ${9:optional_formatIn}, ${10:optional_flagsIn})$0

ImGui_SliderFlags_AlwaysClamp lua.description:
Clamp value to min/max bounds when input manually with CTRL+Click.
By default CTRL+Click allows going out of bounds.

ImGui_SliderFlags_Logarithmic lua.description:
Make the widget logarithmic (linear otherwise).
Consider using SliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat with this if using a format-string
with small amount of digits.

ImGui_SliderFlags_NoInput lua.description: Disable CTRL+Click or Enter key allowing to input text directly into the widget.

ImGui_SliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat lua.description:
Disable rounding underlying value to match precision of the display format
string (e.g. %.3f values are rounded to those 3 digits).

ImGui_SliderInt4 lua.body: rv, v1, v2, v3, v4 = ImGui.SliderInt4(${1:ctx}, ${2:label}, ${3:v1}, ${4:v2}, ${5:v3}, ${6:v4}, ${7:v_min}, ${8:v_max}, ${9:optional_formatIn}, ${10:optional_flagsIn})$0

ImGui_SmallButton lua.description: Button with StyleVar_FramePadding=(0,0) to easily embed within text.

ImGui_StyleVar_Alpha lua.description: Global alpha applies to everything in Dear ImGui.

ImGui_StyleVar_ButtonTextAlign lua.description:
Alignment of button text when button is larger than text.
Defaults to (0.5, 0.5) (centered).

ImGui_StyleVar_ChildBorderSize lua.description:
Thickness of border around child windows. Generally set to 0.0 or 1.0.
(Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).

ImGui_StyleVar_ChildRounding lua.description: Radius of child window corners rounding. Set to 0.0 to have rectangular windows.

ImGui_StyleVar_DisabledAlpha lua.description:
Additional alpha multiplier applied by BeginDisabled.
Multiply over current value of Alpha.

ImGui_StyleVar_FrameBorderSize lua.description:
Thickness of border around frames. Generally set to 0.0 or 1.0.
(Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).

ImGui_StyleVar_FramePadding lua.description: Padding within a framed rectangle (used by most widgets).

ImGui_StyleVar_FrameRounding lua.description:
Radius of frame corners rounding.
Set to 0.0 to have rectangular frame (used by most widgets).

ImGui_StyleVar_GrabMinSize lua.description: Minimum width/height of a grab box for slider/scrollbar.

ImGui_StyleVar_GrabRounding lua.description: Radius of grabs corners rounding. Set to 0.0 to have rectangular slider grabs.

ImGui_StyleVar_IndentSpacing lua.description:
Horizontal indentation when e.g. entering a tree node.
Generally == (GetFontSize + StyleVar_FramePadding.x*2).

ImGui_StyleVar_ItemInnerSpacing lua.description:
Horizontal and vertical spacing between within elements of a composed widget
(e.g. a slider and its label).

ImGui_StyleVar_ItemSpacing lua.description: Horizontal and vertical spacing between widgets/lines.

ImGui_StyleVar_PopupBorderSize lua.description:
Thickness of border around popup/tooltip windows. Generally set to 0.0 or 1.0.
(Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).

ImGui_StyleVar_PopupRounding lua.description:
Radius of popup window corners rounding.
(Note that tooltip windows use StyleVar_WindowRounding.)

ImGui_StyleVar_ScrollbarRounding lua.description: Radius of grab corners for scrollbar.

ImGui_StyleVar_ScrollbarSize lua.description: Width of the vertical scrollbar, Height of the horizontal scrollbar.

ImGui_StyleVar_SelectableTextAlign lua.description:
Alignment of selectable text. Defaults to (0.0, 0.0) (top-left aligned).
It's generally important to keep this left-aligned if you want to lay
multiple items on a same line.

ImGui_StyleVar_SeparatorTextAlign lua.description:
Alignment of text within the separator.
Defaults to (0.0, 0.5) (left aligned, center).

ImGui_StyleVar_SeparatorTextPadding lua.description:
Horizontal offset of text from each edge of the separator + spacing on other
axis. Generally small values. .y is recommended to be == StyleVar_FramePadding.y.

ImGui_StyleVar_TabRounding lua.description: Radius of upper corners of a tab. Set to 0.0 to have rectangular tabs.

ImGui_StyleVar_WindowBorderSize lua.description:
Thickness of border around windows. Generally set to 0.0 or 1.0.
(Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).

ImGui_StyleVar_WindowMinSize lua.description:
Minimum window size. This is a global setting.
If you want to constrain individual windows, use SetNextWindowSizeConstraints.

ImGui_StyleVar_WindowRounding lua.description:
Radius of window corners rounding. Set to 0.0 to have rectangular windows.
Large values tend to lead to variety of artifacts and are not recommended.

ImGui_StyleVar_WindowTitleAlign lua.description:
Alignment for title bar text.
Defaults to (0.0,0.5) for left-aligned,vertically centered.

ImGui_TabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs lua.description: Automatically select new tabs when they appear.

ImGui_TabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDow.description: Resize tabs when they don't fit.

ImGui_TabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll lu.description: Add scroll buttons when tabs don't fit.

ImGui_TabBarFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouse.description:
Disable behavior of closing tabs (that are submitted with p_open != nil)
with middle mouse button. You can still repro this behavior on user's side
with if(IsItemHovered() && IsMouseClicked(2)) p_open = false.

ImGui_TabBarFlags_NoTabListScrollingButt.description:
Disable scrolling buttons (apply when fitting policy is
TabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll).

ImGui_TabBarFlags_NoTooltip lua.description: Disable tooltips when hovering a tab.

ImGui_TabBarFlags_Reorderable lua.description:
Allow manually dragging tabs to re-order them + New tabs are appended at
the end of list.

ImGui_TabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton lua.description: Disable buttons to open the tab list popup.

ImGui_TabItemButton lua.description:
Create a Tab behaving like a button. Return true when clicked.
Cannot be selected in the tab bar.

ImGui_TabItemFlags_Leading lua.description: Enforce the tab position to the left of the tab bar (after the tab list popup button).

ImGui_TabItemFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMous.description:
Disable behavior of closing tabs (that are submitted with p_open != nil) with
middle mouse button. You can still repro this behavior on user's side with
if(IsItemHovered() && IsMouseClicked(2)) p_open = false.

ImGui_TabItemFlags_NoReorder lua.description: Disable reordering this tab or having another tab cross over this tab.

ImGui_TabItemFlags_NoTooltip lua.description: Disable tooltip for the given tab.

ImGui_TabItemFlags_SetSelected lua.description: Trigger flag to programmatically make the tab selected when calling BeginTabItem.

ImGui_TabItemFlags_Trailing lua.description: Enforce the tab position to the right of the tab bar (before the scrolling buttons).

ImGui_TabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument lua.description:
Append '*' to title without affecting the ID, as a convenience to avoid using
the ### operator. Also: tab is selected on closure and closure is deferred by
one frame to allow code to undo it without flicker.

ImGui_TableBgTarget_RowBg0 lua.description:
Set row background color 0 (generally used for background,
automatically set when TableFlags_RowBg is used).

ImGui_TableBgTarget_RowBg1 lua.description: Set row background color 1 (generally used for selection marking).

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_Disabled lua.description:
Overriding/master disable flag: hide column, won't show in context menu
(unlike calling TableSetColumnEnabled which manipulates the user accessible state).

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_IndentDisable lua.description:
Ignore current Indent value when entering cell (default for columns > 0).
Indentation changes _within_ the cell will still be honored.

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_IndentEnable lua.description: Use current Indent value when entering cell (default for column 0).

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_IsEnabled lua.description:
Status: is enabled == not hidden by user/api (referred to as 'Hide' in
_DefaultHide and _NoHide) flags.

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_IsSorted lua.description: Status: is currently part of the sort specs.

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_IsVisible lua.description: Status: is visible == is enabled AND not clipped by scrolling.

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_NoClip lua.description:
Disable clipping for this column
(all NoClip columns will render in a same draw command).

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_NoHeaderLabel lua.description:
TableHeadersRow will not submit label for this column.
Convenient for some small columns. Name will still appear in context menu.

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_NoHeaderWidth lua.description: Disable header text width contribution to automatic column width.

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_NoHide lua.description: Disable ability to hide/disable this column.

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_NoReorder lua.description:
Disable manual reordering this column, this will also prevent other columns
from crossing over this column.

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_NoSort lua.description:
Disable ability to sort on this field
(even if TableFlags_Sortable is set on the table).

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_NoSortAscending l.description: Disable ability to sort in the ascending direction.

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_NoSortDescending.description: Disable ability to sort in the descending direction.

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_PreferSortAscendi.description: Make the initial sort direction Ascending when first sorting on this column (default).

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescend.description: Make the initial sort direction Descending when first sorting on this column.

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_WidthFixed lua.description:
Column will not stretch. Preferable with horizontal scrolling enabled
(default if table sizing policy is _SizingFixedFit and table is resizable).

ImGui_TableColumnFlags_WidthStretch lua.description:
Column will stretch. Preferable with horizontal scrolling disabled
(default if table sizing policy is _SizingStretchSame or _SizingStretchProp).

ImGui_TableFlags_BordersOuterH lua.description: Draw horizontal borders at the top and bottom.

ImGui_TableFlags_BordersOuterV lua.description: Draw vertical borders on the left and right sides.

ImGui_TableFlags_ContextMenuInBody lua.description:
Right-click on columns body/contents will display table context menu.
By default it is available in TableHeadersRow.

ImGui_TableFlags_Hideable lua.description: Enable hiding/disabling columns in context menu.

ImGui_TableFlags_NoClip lua.description:
Disable clipping rectangle for every individual columns
(reduce draw command count, items will be able to overflow into other columns).
Generally incompatible with TableSetupScrollFreeze.

ImGui_TableFlags_NoHostExtendX lua.description:
Make outer width auto-fit to columns, overriding outer_size.x value. Only
available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled and Stretch columns are not used.

ImGui_TableFlags_NoHostExtendY lua.description:
Make outer height stop exactly at outer_size.y (prevent auto-extending table
past the limit). Only available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled.
Data below the limit will be clipped and not visible.

ImGui_TableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible lu.description:
Disable keeping column always minimally visible when ScrollX is off and table
gets too small. Not recommended if columns are resizable.

ImGui_TableFlags_NoPadInnerX lua.description:
Disable inner padding between columns (double inner padding if
TableFlags_BordersOuterV is on, single inner padding if BordersOuterV is off).

ImGui_TableFlags_NoPadOuterX lua.description: Default if TableFlags_BordersOuterV is off. Disable outermost padding.

ImGui_TableFlags_NoSavedSettings lua.description: Disable persisting columns order, width and sort settings in the .ini file.

ImGui_TableFlags_PadOuterX lua.description:
Default if TableFlags_BordersOuterV is on. Enable outermost padding.
Generally desirable if you have headers.

ImGui_TableFlags_PreciseWidths lua.description:
Disable distributing remainder width to stretched columns (width allocation
on a 100-wide table with 3 columns: Without this flag: 33,33,34. With this
flag: 33,33,33).
With larger number of columns, resizing will appear to be less smooth.

ImGui_TableFlags_Reorderable lua.description:
Enable reordering columns in header row
(need calling TableSetupColumn + TableHeadersRow to display headers).

ImGui_TableFlags_RowBg lua.description:
Set each RowBg color with Col_TableRowBg or Col_TableRowBgAlt (equivalent of
calling TableSetBgColor with TableBgTarget_RowBg0 on each row manually).

ImGui_TableFlags_ScrollX lua.description:
Enable horizontal scrolling. Require 'outer_size' parameter of BeginTable to
specify the container size. Changes default sizing policy.
Because this creates a child window, ScrollY is currently generally
recommended when using ScrollX.

ImGui_TableFlags_ScrollY lua.description:
Enable vertical scrolling.
Require 'outer_size' parameter of BeginTable to specify the container size.

ImGui_TableFlags_SizingFixedFit lua.description:
Columns default to _WidthFixed or _WidthAuto (if resizable or not resizable),
matching contents width.

ImGui_TableFlags_SizingFixedSame lua.description:
Columns default to _WidthFixed or _WidthAuto (if resizable or not resizable),
matching the maximum contents width of all columns.
Implicitly enable TableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible.

ImGui_TableFlags_SizingStretchProp lua.description:
Columns default to _WidthStretch with default weights proportional to each
columns contents widths.

ImGui_TableFlags_SizingStretchSame lua.description:
Columns default to _WidthStretch with default weights all equal,
unless overriden by TableSetupColumn.

ImGui_TableFlags_SortMulti lua.description:
Hold shift when clicking headers to sort on multiple column.
TableGetGetSortSpecs may return specs where (SpecsCount > 1).

ImGui_TableFlags_SortTristate lua.description:
Allow no sorting, disable default sorting.
TableGetColumnSortSpecs may return specs where (SpecsCount == 0).

ImGui_TableFlags_Sortable lua.description:
Enable sorting. Call TableNeedSort/TableGetColumnSortSpecs to obtain sort specs.
Also see TableFlags_SortMulti and TableFlags_SortTristate.

ImGui_TableGetColumnCount lua.description: Return number of columns (value passed to BeginTable).

ImGui_TableGetColumnFlags lua.description:
Return column flags so you can query their Enabled/Visible/Sorted/Hovered
status flags. Pass -1 to use current column.

ImGui_TableGetColumnName lua.description:
Return '' if column didn't have a name declared by TableSetupColumn.
Pass -1 to use current column.

ImGui_TableGetColumnSortSpecs lua.description:
Sorting specification for one column of a table.
Call while incrementing 'id' from 0 until false is returned.
- ColumnUserID:  User id of the column (if specified by a TableSetupColumn call)
- ColumnIndex:   Index of the column
- SortOrder:     Index within parent SortSpecs (always stored in order starting
from 0, tables sorted on a single criteria will always have a 0 here)
- SortDirection: SortDirection_Ascending or SortDirection_Descending
(you can use this or SortSign, whichever is more convenient for your sort
function)
See TableNeedSort.

ImGui_TableHeader lua.description: Submit one header cell manually (rarely used). See TableSetupColumn.

ImGui_TableHeadersRow lua.description:
Submit all headers cells based on data provided to TableSetupColumn +
submit context menu.

ImGui_TableNeedSort lua.description:
Return true once when sorting specs have changed since last call,
or the first time. 'has_specs' is false when not sorting.
See TableGetColumnSortSpecs.

ImGui_TableNextColumn lua.description:
Append into the next column (or first column of next row if currently in
last column). Return true when column is visible.

ImGui_TableNextRow lua.description: Append into the first cell of a new row.

ImGui_TableRowFlags_Headers lua.description:
Identify header row (set default background color + width of its contents
accounted different for auto column width).

ImGui_TableSetBgColor lua.description:
Change the color of a cell, row, or column.
See TableBgTarget_* flags for details.

ImGui_TableSetColumnEnabled lua.description:
Change user-accessible enabled/disabled state of a column, set to false to
hide the column. Note that end-user can use the context menu to change this
themselves (right-click in headers, or right-click in columns body with
TableFlags_ContextMenuInBody).
- Require table to have the TableFlags_Hideable flag because we are manipulating
user accessible state.
- Request will be applied during next layout, which happens on the first call to
TableNextRow after Begin_Table.
- For the getter you can test
(TableGetColumnFlags() & TableColumnFlags_IsEnabled) != 0.

ImGui_TableSetColumnIndex lua.description: Append into the specified column. Return true when column is visible.

ImGui_TableSetupColumn lua.description:
Use to specify label, resizing policy, default width/weight, id,
various other flags etc.

ImGui_TableSetupScrollFreeze lua.description: Lock columns/rows so they stay visible when scrolled.

ImGui_TextColored lua.description: Shortcut for PushStyleColor(Col_Text, color); Text(text); PopStyleColor();

ImGui_TextWrapped lua.description:
Shortcut for PushTextWrapPos(0.0); Text(text); PopTextWrapPos();.
Note that this won't work on an auto-resizing window if there's no other
widgets to extend the window width, yoy may need to set a size using
SetNextWindowSize.

ImGui_TreeNode lua.description:
TreeNode functions return true when the node is open, in which case you need
to also call TreePop when you are finished displaying the tree node contents.

ImGui_TreeNodeEx lua.description:
Helper variation to easily decorelate the id from the displayed string.
Read the [FAQ](https://dearimgui.com/faq) about why and how to use ID.
To align arbitrary text at the same level as a TreeNode you can use Bullet.

ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_AllowOverlap lua.description: Hit testing to allow subsequent widgets to overlap this one.

ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_Bullet lua.description: Display a bullet instead of arrow.

ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_FramePadding lua.description:
Use FramePadding (even for an unframed text node) to vertically align text
baseline to regular widget height.
Equivalent to calling AlignTextToFramePadding.

ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_Framed lua.description: Draw frame with background (e.g. for CollapsingHeader).

ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_Leaf lua.description: No collapsing, no arrow (use as a convenience for leaf nodes).

ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_NoAutoOpenOnLog lua.description:
Don't automatically and temporarily open node when Logging is active
(by default logging will automatically open tree nodes).

ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen lua.description:
Don't do a TreePush when open (e.g. for CollapsingHeader)
= no extra indent nor pushing on ID stack.

ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow lua.description:
Only open when clicking on the arrow part.
If TreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick is also set, single-click arrow or
double-click all box to open.

ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth lua.description:
Extend hit box to the right-most edge, even if not framed.
This is not the default in order to allow adding other items on the same line.
In the future we may refactor the hit system to be front-to-back,
allowing natural overlaps and then this can become the default.

ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth lua.description: Extend hit box to the left-most and right-most edges (bypass the indented area).

ImGui_TreePush lua.description:
Indent()+PushID(). Already called by TreeNode when returning true,
but you can call TreePush/TreePop yourself if desired.

ImGui_Unindent lua.description:
Move content position back to the left, by 'indent_w', or
StyleVar_IndentSpacing if 'indent_w' <= 0

ImGui_ValidatePtr lua.description:
Return whether the pointer of the specified type is valid.
Supported types are:
- ImGui_Context*
- ImGui_DrawList*
- ImGui_DrawListSplitter*
- ImGui_Font*
- ImGui_Function*
- ImGui_Image*
- ImGui_ImageSet*
- ImGui_ListClipper*
- ImGui_TextFilter*
- ImGui_Viewport*

ImGui_Viewport_GetPos lua.description: Main Area: Position of the viewport

ImGui_Viewport_GetSize lua.description: Main Area: Size of the viewport.

ImGui_Viewport_GetWorkCenter lua.description: Center of the viewport's work area.

ImGui_WindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize lua.description: Resize every window to its content every frame.

ImGui_WindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScroll.description: Always show horizontal scrollbar (even if ContentSize.x < Size.x).

ImGui_WindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding.description:
Ensure child windows without border uses StyleVar_WindowPadding
(ignored by default for non-bordered child windows, because more convenient).

ImGui_WindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollba.description: Always show vertical scrollbar (even if ContentSize.y < Size.y).

ImGui_WindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar lu.description:
Allow horizontal scrollbar to appear (off by default).
You may use SetNextWindowContentSize(width, 0.0) prior to calling Begin() to
specify width. Read code in the demo's 'Horizontal Scrolling' section.

ImGui_WindowFlags_NoBackground lua.description:
Disable drawing background color (WindowBg, etc.) and outside border.
Similar as using SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.0).

ImGui_WindowFlags_NoCollapse lua.description:
Disable user collapsing window by double-clicking on it.
Also referred to as Window Menu Button (e.g. within a docking node).

ImGui_WindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing lua.description: Disable taking focus when transitioning from hidden to visible state.

ImGui_WindowFlags_NoMouseInputs lua.description: Disable catching mouse, hovering test with pass through.

ImGui_WindowFlags_NoNavFocus lua.description:
No focusing toward this window with gamepad/keyboard navigation
(e.g. skipped by CTRL+TAB).

ImGui_WindowFlags_NoNavInputs lua.description: No gamepad/keyboard navigation within the window.

ImGui_WindowFlags_NoResize lua.description: Disable user resizing with the lower-right grip.

ImGui_WindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse lua.description:
Disable user vertically scrolling with mouse wheel.
On child window, mouse wheel will be forwarded to the parent unless
NoScrollbar is also set.

ImGui_WindowFlags_NoScrollbar lua.description: Disable scrollbars (window can still scroll with mouse or programmatically).
